ratings.comment: Lectures weren't super useful, but it was still interesting sometimes if you could get over his accent. Textbook (I took the class before the switch to packets) was very useful and taught me everything.  I recommend getting it anyways (Thomas' Calculus). Exams were identical to practice exams.

Most certainly the worst professor I've ever had. I went to lecture the first two months but gave up after the first midterm. I actually did better teaching myself with the text book and watching online videos. If you have a choice, pick a different professor. You may think all the reviews are from jaded students, think again. This guy is bad news.

Definitely the worst professor I've ever had. Lectures are very difficult to understand because he makes so many mistakes (TAs always had to correct him) and he goes on tangents quite often. (no pun intended) If you have the option, take someone else. If you don't have a choice, then skip lecture and read the book or work on problems with a tutor.

Smart professor, but possibly too smart for this level of course. Received corrections multiple times during lecture because he was unsure what he was talking about. He also only taught at a level he could comprehend, not something that everyone could comprehend. The TA's provided for the discussions were either knowledgeable or dry teachers.

Smart professor, but possibly too smart for this level of course. Received corrections multiple times during lecture because he was unsure what he was talking about. He also only taught at a level he could comprehend, not something that everyone could comprehend.

If I could give a rating of zero, I would give Professor Oh that rating. Math was one of my favorite classes in high school but not any more. Oh's class is impossible. He is without doubt a smart guy. He just has no idea how to teach. His class is way more challenging than it should be simply because e is a horrible instructor.

He isn't so great at communicating. His board is so disorganized. He seems like he knows his stuff, but is very poor at conveying them. He is not very helpful. I didn't have a good experience learning in his class at all.

Spent the first day teaching him the equations like cos a+b etc. because he "only knows them in Korean." Things got a bit better when he brought a piece of paper with notes on what he was teaching, but I would switch out ASAP.

Horrible. Just no. Blackboard writing is kind of everywhere and is hard to understand because of his accent. I apologize to all who have/will have him as a professor. GO TO DISCUSSION - your TA will be your best friend.
WOW, terrible.  Mistakes at even simple levels of problems.  Worst professor so far. I can not imagine anyone worse.

while a nice guy, his classes are extremely painful to sit through. he will often make mistakes, and not cover material but still expect you to know it. people eventually stop coming to class. his tests are okay.

Not a very good professor. His lectures were sometimes hard to follow and hard to understand. His exams are straight forward. He seems very lazy when it comes to writing them because he takes 1 or 2 of the exact same problems from previous exams. The curves are brutal (for one exam, you needed at least a 93 for an A).

Not the greatest calc professor in the world, but his lack of good English makes him very "to the point".  He makes a ton of mistakes, but the essential formulas are always presented and he goes though examples not in the book.  Test curves are AWFUL but the tests are very similar to previous years. If you get him, its not the end of the world.

Worst professor ever.  Makes at least 3 mistakes everyday during lecture.  The TA's are constantly correcting him and he teaches directly from the book. Don't go to lecture ever, you will be better off.  The only reason I go to class is to laugh at his mistakes.
Worst professor I have had thus far at UW-Madison. I stopped going to lecture altogether after a month, and my grade actually improved. Literally the biggest waste of my time.

Literally the worst teacher in the world. he doesnt understand what he's teaching, and does not provide any help. teaches out of the book so you cant look up practice problems for help. the worst teacher in the university
This guy is terrible... Curves suck and he is a really bad teacher. Better off learning from the Thomas Calculus book. I didn't attend a single lecture and did just fine in the class.

He just can't teach.  My friend and I are convinced that he is North Korea's secret plan to ruin American's education system and it's working so far.  Hint: Replace lecture with TA office hours and maybe you can stand a chance. But he might just screw everyone over with his unedited tests and ridiculous curves
Awful professor, makes lots of mistakes during lecture; rarely can answer questions during lecture because he cannot understand people's questions. Stray away or teach yourself

Worst math professor I've ever had. Hard to understand, screws up book examples all the time, and writes impossible exams. Second midterm he gave us without revising it, so we were interrupted about 3 times to correct the bounds of an integration problem...just horrible!

Worst professor I've ever had. Constantly makes mistakes during class, and is nearly incomprehensible because he mumbles half the time. Oh, and no partial credit on a portion of all of the exams, which is ridiculous in calculus.

~~1) 1/4 to 1/3 of his exams are NO PARTIAL CREDIT (for math wtf) + the other questions are poorly written ~~2) He screws up all the time on the board & uses examples from the book & still screws them up ~~3) he's foreign & doesn't explain things well at all~~~ THIS PROF IS TERRIBLE.  He's not dumb but, I have no idea how he was elected to teach.

He is terrible in all ways. My morale for math is not great, but he certainly lowered it to all time lows. I tried hard, had a tutor, and still struggled. He screws up often, and this is perhaps one of the most difficult classes in the University overall.

Makes many errors in lecture, and is sometimes hard to understand with his accent. Spends large portions of lecture teaching something, only to realize he messed something up early on. Review solutions aren't always correct. TA is alot of help.
He probably knows the subject well but he constantly gives wrong answers and his solutions to review problems are a joke - they aren't helpful at all.
Very hard to understand and follow his teaching on top of a very hard class.  He just zooms through proofs and if you can't keep up, you're done.  Amazed that I got out of this class alive!
No Comments
I would not recomend Oh unless you like professors who are constantly making mistakes, and spending the majority of the class correcting them.
His lectures are very unorganized, and he has trouble explaining concepts because his english is poor.

The course itself is pretty hard, but he lets you use a cheat sheet on the exams.  Also, he makes reviews before every exam and they are almost the same as the actual exam.  However, don't take this class unless you are required to!
